unnormalised: Lights, Camera, FESTIVALS! The entertainment world is buzzing with film festival fever! From Cannes to Kerala, cinephiles are flocking to catch the latest indie flicks and blockbuster premieres.
normalised: Lights, Camera, FESTIVALS! The entertainment world is buzzing with film festival fever! From Cannes to Kerala, cinephiles are flocking to catch the latest indie flicks and blockbuster premieres.

unnormalised: Word on the street is the Mumbai Film Festival is gearing up for a massive comeback this November after a brief hiatus, and everyone's hoping SRK might make an appearance. Imagine the selfies!
normalised: Word on the street is the Mumbai Film Festival is gearing up for a massive comeback this November after a brief hiatus, and everyone's hoping S R K might make an appearance. Imagine the selfies!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, down south, the IFFK (International Film Festival of Kerala) rumours are flying about a special screening of a long-lost Adoor Gopalakrishnan film. Should be epic!
normalised: Meanwhile, down south, the I F F K (International Film Festival of Kerala) rumours are flying about a special screening of a long-lost Adoor Gopalakrishnan film. Should be epic!

unnormalised: But it's not just about the movies, folks. It's about the after-parties, the celeb sightings, and of course, the food. Picture this: devouring some spicy Hyderabadi biryani after a thought-provoking documentary. That's the REAL festival experience!
normalised: But it's not just about the movies, folks. It's about the after-parties, the celeb sightings, and of course, the food. Picture this: devouring some spicy Hyderabadi biryani after a thought-provoking documentary. That's the REAL festival experience!

unnormalised: Don't forget the countless independent filmmakers hoping their labour of love will finally get some recognition. Fingers crossed for some brilliant new Indian talent to break through! Let's see who takes home the black lady! Maybe even a golden one!
normalised: Don't forget the countless independent filmmakers hoping their labor of love will finally get some recognition. Fingers crossed for some brilliant new Indian talent to break through! Let's see who takes home the black lady! Maybe even a golden one!
